title: 284-A
statement: A. Cows and Primitive Rootstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutThe cows have just learned what a primitive root is! Given a primep, a primitive rootis an integerx(1 ≤x<p)such that none of integersx- 1,x2- 1, ...,xp- 2- 1are divisible byp, butxp- 1- 1is.Unfortunately, computing primitive roots can be time consuming, so the cows need your help. Given a primep, help the cows find the number of primitive roots.InputThe input contains a single line containing an integerp(2 ≤p< 2000). It is guaranteed thatpis a prime.OutputOutput on a single line the number of primitive roots.ExamplesInput3Output1Input5Output2NoteThe only primitive rootis2.The primitive rootsare2and3.

processed.result:
Given a prime number $p$, find the number of primitive roots modulo $p$.

A primitive root modulo $p$ is an integer $x$ (where $1 \le x < p$) such that:

*  $x-1$, $x^2-1$, ..., $x^{p-2}-1$ are not divisible by $p$, but 
* $x^{p-1}-1$ is divisible by $p$. 


Input:

A single line containing an integer $p$ (where $2 \le p < 2000$). It is guaranteed that $p$ is prime.

Output:

Output a single line containing the number of primitive roots modulo $p$.
Given a prime number, find the number of numbers less than the prime number that meet a specific condition.
